results.title: Norbert
results.creator_credit: Michael Hill and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Animated ‘fractured fairytale’ story about Norbert, with abnormally big ears, and the prejudices he faces from the local townsfolk. Being different, Norbert soon discovers, means a lonely and alienated life. A rather bleak piece laced with moments of off-beat black humour. Narrated by V J Shanmugam.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Nora
results.creator_credit: Volta Films, Gam Films, Road Movies Vierte Produktionen, Bradley Adams, Damon Bryant, Trace Seaward and Pat Murphy
results.brief_description: Based on the biography of Nora Barnacle, who remained James Joyce’s lifelong lover and the inspiration for much of his work. The film traces their sexually charged and turbulent relationship which began in Dublin in 1904 and survived through periods of poverty, jealousy, pride and betrayal. Moving to Europe to escape the confining traditions and religious attitudes of Ireland, the couple endured years of hardship and despair, interspersed with moments of extravagance, to pursue Joyce’s literary aspirations. The passionate relationship between these two strong-willed individuals survived until Joyce’s death in 1941. Ewan McGregor and Susan Lynch star as James Joyce and Nora Barnacle. Cast also includes Peter McDonald and Roberto Citran. Screenplay, Pat Murphy and Gerard Stembridge based upon the biography by Brenda Maddox. Music, Stanislas Syrewicz. Editing, Pia Di Giavla. Cinematography, Jean Francois Robin.

results.title: Nonverbal communication (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Harper & Row, Stanley Milgram and Harry From
results.brief_description: Examines scientific findings on communication through gesture, body posture, intonation, eye contact, and facial expression. Includes interviews with experts on interpersonal distance, the equilibrium theory of eye contact, sex differences in the perception of nonverbal behaviour, gestures and expression in photos, and biological programing.

results.title: Nonsense = Nesmysl
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, Milos Macourek, Vykasnik Born and Hudba Fiser
results.brief_description: The everchanging daydreams of a small boy are viewed with suspicion by his friends, his parents, and his doctor. However, when his parents realise that his dreams have commercial value, the boy is exploited until his dreams, like the flowers that inspire him, wither and die. Animated with music and sound effects. No spoken language. Animators: Janoslav Doubrava, Josef Hekrala, Vera Macesova

results.title: Nonoonse Anishinabe Ishichekewin Ka Kanawentank
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott, Sara Berger and Elise Swerhone
results.brief_description: Western pioneers knew that sugar could be made from the sap of the Manitoba maple. But the trees were small, the sap was thin, and the tastier product of Quebec and Ontario was cheap and easy to get. The settler soon turned away from the arduous annual harvest and the Manitoba maple became just another tree. But not for Nonoonse. Forty years ago her grandmother brought her to Sugar Island. Since then she has returned every spring to gather the sweet sap. Filmed on Lake Manitoba, near the Ebb’n’Flow Reserve, Nonoonse is both a clear description of sugar-making and a quiet statement on the importance of the tradition to the Saultaux Indians of the region. (Bilingual: English and Saulteaux.)

results.title: None to trouble nobody
results.brief_description: Dealing with the modern social problem of housing and caring for old people, the film shows what is being done in the United Kingdom by the Women’s Voluntary Service towards solving the problem.

results.title: None for the road
results.brief_description: A discussion of the problem of teenage drinking and driving. Three college men, one doing no drinking, one drinking beer, and one drinking heavily, are studied. The results are compared to the effects of equivalent amounts of alcohol on rats. Depicts an accident resulting from only casual drinking before driving.

results.title: None but the brave
results.creator_credit: Sinatra Enterprises, Artanis and Frank Sinatra
results.brief_description:
Debuting director Frank Sinatra stars in this suspenseful war drama, the first American/Japanese film made in the United States. The story moves tautly between two enemy camps (both stranded on a deserted Pacific Island during World War II, both facing the same struggle for survival), gunfire is their only contact. Then the Japanese leader (Tatsuya Mihashi) offers to swap water for the aid of the American Pharmacist Maloney (Sinatra), whom he’s mistaken for a doctor. When Maloney amputates the leg of a Japanese soldier and saves his life, peace breaks out between the two camps. But can it last? There are two sides to every war… this movie shows the heroism of both sides… and the respect that can develop among courageous men at war.
Cast includes: Frank Sinatra, Clint Walker, Tatsuya Mihashi, Tony Bill.

results.title: Non-verbal communication
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Briefly looks at four aspects of non-verbal communication and what they indicate. ‘Gestures’ often reveal insecurity, ‘Posture’ relates to dominance and submission, ‘Personal space’ consists of four invisible zones, intimate, personal, social and public, ‘Eye contact’ is often used to co-ordinate and synchronise conversation.

results.title: Non-objective art
results.brief_description: Defines non-objective (abstract) art and explains how it differs from other types of painting. Points out non-objective things in nature; discusses basic elements (line, shape, color), the uses of non-objective art in industrial design, and the interests of a creative painter. Includes examples of non-objective paintings.
